snippet: Who is ultimately responsible for the massive fire at a Bangladesh factory last month?
abstract: Who is ultimately responsible for the massive fire at a Bangladesh factory last month?
lead_paragraph: “The fire alarm shattered the monotony of the Tazreen Fashions factory. Hundreds of seamstresses looked up from their machines, startled. On the third floor, Shima Akhter Pakhi had been stitching hoods onto fleece jackets. Now she ran to a staircase,” Jim Yardley wrote in The New York Times, abouta blaze that killed 112 workers last month, at the factory in Bangladesh, which made clothing “destined for some of the world’s top retailers.”

headline.main: Bangladesh Fire Exposes Safety Gap in Supply Chain
